subject: Science
title: Why Wind Blows
description: A quick win: understand Why Wind Blows.

hook.text: Wind isn't random. It's air rushing from high pressure to low pressure.

buildup.text: The bigger the pressure difference, the stronger the wind.

discovery.text: But wind doesn't blow in a straight line. Earth's rotation curves it.

twist.text: This is the Coriolis effect â€” it bends winds right in the north, left in the south.

climax.text: Without the Coriolis effect, weather patterns would be completely different.

punchline.text: Wind is just air trying to equalize pressure â€” bent by a spinning planet.

quiz.question: What causes wind to curve instead of blowing in straight lines?
